title: Exciting times ahead for eSports
text:
It is truly a great to time to be involved in the development of gaming.
It looks as though gaming has reached, or has almost reached, the pinnacle of where it should be with some competitions offering as much as US$18,000,000.00 in prize money and with a number of professional teams in existence that offer the gamers some pretty good salaries.
However, I believe that the best is yet to come.
The prize-money offered in eSports is pretty mediocre when compared to the more established and accredited sports.
When Silviu 'NightEnd' Lazar, of Romania, was in South Africa for the Romania vs South Africa StarCraft II Test Match in March 2013, he was truly amazed to see the winnings leader-board for golf at the Johannesburg Country Club at where he was treated to breakfast.
On the whole eSports falls far behind the other sports.
However, IeSF is trying to remedy such shortfall.
The way in which IeSF is helping eSports reach its full potential is by getting the 'establishment' to see eSports as a major sport and include eSports into the major multi-sport events.
Already IeSF under the astute stewardship of Alex Lim has been able to include eSports in the Asian Games.
IeSF has also managed to get eSports accepted into TAFISA's World Sport for All Games 2016 to be held in Jakarta, Indonesia.
Thus, according to the latest press release issued by IeSF, Jun Byung Hun, the president of International e-Sports Federation (IeSF), visited Jakarta, Indonesia on 29th of September and had meetings with Ms. Rita Subowo, the president of Indonesia NOC.
Apparently the role of eSports in the TAFISA World Games in 2016, the Asian Youth Games in 2017 and the Asian Games in 2018 was on the agenda.
It seems as though Ms. Rita is desirous to see the inclusion of eSporrts as she herself stated, “We would like to take e-Sport into 2017 Asian Youth Games in Indonesia. Through this, we will also be able to see possibility of e-Sports to be selected in further multi sports events.”
Thus eSports finds itself on the cusp of huge developments in the way in which eSports are run and the benefits that will accrue to every national member that is currently participating in the affairs of IeSF.
It is an exciting time to be a gamer as those who are currently gaming, if a member of an accredited national eSports federation, like Mind Sports South Africa, are at the very heart of the exciting developments that are going to burst upon the scene.
